question.title: Using --add-opens in prunsrv.exe with JDK 17
question.body:
I'm trying to upgrade a Java service that uses Documentum API (dfc.jar), from JDK 11 to JDK 17. It runs with prunsrv (Apache Commons Daemon Service Runner).

Searching on Opentext forums, it seems that I need to add --add-opens=java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED to the list of JVM arguments in order to keep my code with the new JDK.

I'm doing this in my install.bat:

set JAVA_OPTS=--JvmMs=256 --JvmMx=512 --add-opens=java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED
set INSTALL_PARAMS=%INSTALL_PARAMS% %JAVA_OPTS%

But, when I execute it, I get:

E:\installationPath>E:\installationPath\myService.exe //IS//myService_Java17  --Install=E:\installationPath\myService.exe --Description="My Service" --Classpath=E:\installationPath\myService.jar --Startup=manual --StartMode=jvm --Jvm=C:\temp\jdk-17.0.15_windows-x64_bin\jdk-17.0.15\bin\server\jvm.dll --JvmMs=256 --JvmMx=512 --add-opens=java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED --StartClass=it.reply.square.isa.daemon.Service --StartMethod=main --StartParams=start --StopMode=jvm --StopClass=it.reply.square.isa.daemon.Service --StopMethod=main --StopParams=stop --LogPath=E:\installationPath\log --LogLevel=Info --StdOutput=auto --StdError=auto
[error] [ 7560] Unrecognized program option --add-opens
[error] [ 7560] Invalid command line arguments.
[error] [ 7560] Apache Commons Daemon procrun failed with exit value: 1 (failed to parse command line arguments).

I am using these components:

  • JDK 17.0.15 (changing the JAVA_HOME accordingly)
  • dfc.jar version 23.4
  • Apache Commons Daemon Service Runner 1.4.1.0

Thank you for any insight, and please ask me anything else that could be useful for addressing the issue.

answers.body:
--add-opens is a Java argument for the application, not an Apache Commons Daemon Service Runner argument. You need to wrap it inside a --JvmOptions argument so the Service Runner adds it to the command line of the application.

Example: ... --JvmOptions="--add-opens=java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED" ...

79790253.body: @Andrea Thanks for the update. The syntax was correct for the command line but Oracle documented that "In a JNLP file for Java Web Start, you must include an equals sign between --add-opens and its value.". Apparently the same situation applies here. I updated the answer to avoid future confusions.

Thank you so much for your help, it has been crucial! After some testing, I just want to add a bit for who would have the same problem. In fact, with your exact synthax, I got this when starting the Windows service: service terminated with the following service-specific error: The system cannot open the file.. So, I had to replace the blank with an "=", this is my definitive line: set JAVA_OPTS=--JvmMs=256 --JvmMx=512 --JvmOptions="--add-opens=java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED"
